originalText: le_jeremy
Start Element
jeremy
Xit! We're under attack!
Xer.
::He stares through you, holding a t-flask filled with mushroom brew.:: Xit. All of it.
Eh, you new, $(#man/sis)?
Sorry, I've got a lotta work right now.
Done.

::An alluring scent invites you inside: It's rich, pleasant and strong enough to draw a hopper out of its crevice; it's like coffee - but smells infinitely better than the dark-brown dust-mixed-with-water consumed throughout South Underrail. This - this is something from the North. 

And if the delightful aroma is any indication, tasting it has got to be quite an experience.::
Yes?
context.faction_xpbl_aegis_betrayed
No hard feelings, $(#man/sis).
Thanks for everything you did for the expedition, $(#man/sis).
I managed to recover some interesting stuff.
Got something interesting for you.
context.npc_xpbl_seeger_waitRecovery

::You take a step toward the man sitting at the desk, looking at letters and numbers and symbols of various kinds scrolling across his screen. He hears you and turns around, and in his hand - a t-flask of smoking black liquid. It *is* coffee after all.::

Yo, you need something?
Are you Jeremy Seeger? Professor Oldfield told me to see you.
::With a trembling voice.:: You... go see Chief Briggs down there.

::He takes a sip of coffee, holding the cup with both of his trembling hands.:: 

Xit! It's all my fault.

I could've been taken away down there - or xed on the spot! ::He looks at his t-flask with gratitude.:: But I went to get some coffee. Saved my *X*.
What's going on? Any news on the professor?
::You find Seeger packing his equipment, scratching his head in wonder as to why a particular device won't fit the box.::
::He's still packing his equipment. ::

I'm not going down there again. Xit. I somehow got over the dead bodies, but angry pirates...? ::He takes a nervous sip.::

Xem!

::He stares at the screen, twisting one of his locks of hair with his index finger and mumbling to himself. He seems to be unaware of your presence.::

Data, data, data... so much data... and only one XeeGer, mhm, mhm.

::You find him perusing through several medium-sized plastic boxes filled with assorted electronic gadgetry while intermittently and nervously scratching his neck.:: 

Xit! Can't believe we're out.
::He stares unwantingly at his t-flask of coffee.:: Xit.
Xtreme, $(#man/sis)! We gotta get more of those Protectors on our side.
::He takes a sip of coffee.:: This coffee's... xceptional today!
English

::He rubs one of his temples.:: 

I dreamed that serpent again. Xit, these nightmares feel like XR torture sessions. As Ladelman would put it - I got dominated hardcore. 

::He takes a sip of coffee.::
::He rubs his left eye and yawns.::
Good luck. Xile.
Sending it to Professor Oldfield straight away.
It's on the PC.
You can check it out on the PC in my tent.
Yeah. The one.
Seeger. Jeremy Seeger.
'Kay. ::He returns to his work.::
::He occasionally glances at Todd, who is amusing himself with a mobile computer bearing a Unversity of Dis logo, himself also furtively glancing at the coffeemaker.::
::The computers and the coffeemaker are the last to go, it seems.::
What's next, the natives? No thanks. I'll stay here.
Let me tell you... ::He takes a sip of coffee.:: This tent might not be much, but I'll take it over those creepy offices down there any day of the week.

::He flinches and spills some of his coffee over his pants.:: 

XIT, XIT, XIT!

::He flinches.::

Xit! Uh, h-hey. Khm, uh, got something for me, $(#man/sis)?
English
Hey, could you take a look at this for me?
::Leave.::

::He walks outside and looks south toward the beach.:: Look at that bot saunter. Xtreme! ::He takes a sip and returns inside.::

What've you got for me?
Hey, could you take a look at this for me?
Oh. You're back.
Huh?
Got something for me, $(context.player.Name)?
Hey, $(#man/sis). Make it quick.
::He lifts his head a bit, then turns around completely.:: Oh, it's you. What've you got for me?
context.loc_xpbl_nagaOnTheLoose
xpbl_e6
You... gotta be one of the new sec-troopers, huh? Welcome to the Hell's Gut, $(#man/sis). That name seems more and more appropriate the more time we spend here. Am I right now?
English
I have something I want you to take a look at.
::Nod and leave.::
context.npc_xpbl_as_todd_finalDestination
expedition
Hey! Coffee is no, no! Professor *kill* Jeremy - *keeeel* - if Todd drink coffee and gets sick, blaaaurgh.
Now, what've you got for me?
xpbl_e6
English
Hey, could you take a look at this for me?
context.faction_xpbl_expedition_techSupply
Oh, hey there. Nothing... ::He looks at one of the boxes again.:: It's just that we're running out of electronics. I hate it when I don't have stuff.
Oh, hey there. What've you got for me?
Oh, it's you. Let me see...
::He looks at you.:: We're being xterminated.
context.loc_xpbl_e5_nagaAttitude
ally
I don't know. I just feel... full of energy. Xtreme, $(#man/sis), xtreme!
'Kay, $(#man/sis). Go ahead.
Hey, I'm sorry about being a jerk earlier.
Professor Oldfield wants to know if you've compiled the recovered data for him.
What do you do around here?
Is that coffee you're drinking?
English
That coffee you're drinking...
About that coffee...
English
Can I get some more coffee?
You're using some strange words I'm not familiar with. The ones starting with "x."
Tell me about Hexagon.
English
Tell me about Hexagon. Professor already told me a bit but I'd like to hear more.
English
I'd like to know what XR is.
What can you tell me about A-RFID microchips?
::[Intelligence]:: You said a microchip tracks the host's health status. What if they made it so a microchip won't work without a live host?
It seems that the implant does not need a live host to function. It's neither being powered by the host nor is a living one necessary to pass the authentication and authorization checks.
I extracted the microchip from the severed hand...
::His t-flask is beside him, but the coffee is cold.::
::He takes a sip of coffee.::
Well... anyway, what've you got for me?
Sorry, $(#man/sis), I'm xin' out so hard right now. I can't even think straight.
::He nods.::
Uh... why are you talking funny?
Having some fun with Todd, I see.
I just came to say goodbye.

::He pulls down his trainers to his knees, revealing deep-black underpants with overlapping columns of bright green symbols. He grabs a filthy handkerchief from his pocket and starts rubbing the stains.::

You scared the crap outta me!
Xit, $(#man/sis) - I'm burning!
::He then turns to you.:: What've you got for me?
plot.xpbl_mpc_mechanic

::He carefully grasps the slimy tablet with two fingers.::

Hm, yes...
'Kay. I'll get to work straight away.
Sorry?

We were under attack, $(#man/sis). Now, I may be a kind of person that rarely lifts my ass from the chair, but even I'm not that xtreme to sit here and sift through this stuff while people are dying... like, around me.

Well, I'm the person who gets called when a cooler in someone's desktop is "louder than ass," when a mobile "ain't working right" due to fat finger syndrome - and inappropriate usage in general - or when "I lost all mah data 'cause the power died," when in fact his data is fine, he just doesn't know where he's been saving it. ::He sighs.::
This? Yes. Why?
This?
If you weren't such an xer earlier, I'd offer you some. But since you walked out on me...
You want one?
English
If you weren't such an xer earlier, I'd give it to you. But since you walked out on me...
Well...
More, huh? Nnnn-I don't think so, $(#man/sis).
After what you did... Nah, $(#man/sis).

Oh, like xtreme and xit? It's... complicated. It's Hexagonian X-- *Slang*. Sorry, I totally forgot you're a Southerner and you don't know about that stuff. I mean, don't take it the wrong way, $(#man/sis), it's just that you people prefer the Arena, 'kay, since that's what you have here. I mean, not because one is worse than the... uh, than the other. Actually, it's not a really good comparison at all because of the... um... you know.
You know, $(#man/sis), maybe some other time. It's kind of a broad topic and I've got work to do.

While Dis may be the capital of North Underrail, Hexagon is the capital of technology. It's like this microcosm of everything high-tech, a place where you could find pretty much every-xtreme-thing, 'kay.
He did? 'Kay. ::He shrugs.::
Forget I mentioned it. It's just some meaningless Hexagonian slang.
::He looks around.:: 'Kay. But don't tell anyone about this. People don't... understand this kind of stuff.

A-RFID stands for active radio frequency identification. Basically, it means that the microchip has its own power source, as opposed to passive chips, which get powered by a reader. The data I've recovered - with a lot of effort - tells me that NFT used these chips originally for storing personal and medical history, to monitor the host's health status and to keep track of their location. I don't know how the microchip is being powered, by a battery or even by the host himself, but I bet they did a good job on it considering everyone's got them.

Huh...That makes sense. So you can't just chop someone's hand off and use it to pass authorization. And besides, if the microchips *are* being powered by the host's body, they might not even work at all. The could be powered by other means then, but what if they self-destruct if they've been left unpowered for a while, as a precaution. Xit!

Luckily for us, that appears to be the case. That's xcell right there! It probably has a battery. As for the second, either it's an oversight on NFT's part or... I don't know, there could be something we're missing.

Have you tried pulling the hand out of the glove, huh?

::He loses some color just by thinking about it.::

Xtreme... But what for?
Appreciate it. Bye.
English
Just don't touch the xin' coffee, 'kay.
context.npc_xpbl_as_todd_finalDestination
expedition
He's xcell. I'm just... "On the X," as they say. Don't want him hurting himself.
Oh yeah?
Hey, you were xcell, $(#man/sis). If it wasn't for you I'd still be pulling creepy-crawlies out of my hair.
Go ahead. Just keep it quick,
This time you got something for me...
Ah, those are MPCs. Give them here.
Ah, that's an MPC. Give it here.
I can extract data from these kinds of devices - MPCs. This looks like a work tablet, but there are smaller, foldable devices as well. Neat little things. If you come across more of these
::Wait.::
English
*Really* sorry.
::[Persuade]:: *Really* sorry.

::He turns to the computer and opens a file, sighing.::

But yeah, I do have some of the important bits sorted. I'll send it to him as soon as the network's ba-- ::He glances at one of his monitors and raises his eyebrows.:: Oh, Marcus sorted the power. Xtra, xtra... Sending it now.
What I was actually brought here to do is data recovery, decryption, analysis. Xcell. But some people don't realize that and bug me about each and every triviality they encounter.
Never seen coffee before?
I would very much like some coffee.
I opened the Keep and gave you more reasons to drink it.
I think I earned it by now.
I'm not exactly swimming in this stuff. Coffee beans don't grow on rocks, you know. Xem.
I'll cooperate, but it's best we skip the chit-chat.
I should just... I mean, stop talking now. Forget I said anything. ::Silence.::
Some other time. ::He sips some coffee.::
Forget about it, $(#man/sis).
And you, Toddo, this is not for your ears!
'Kay. XR is short for mixed reality. That's *miXed Reality*.
Well, we'll figure it all out once we find one of the microchips. If nothing else, maybe it'll help us learn how to trick the system. In any case, we need it, 'kay.
I needed to implant it into myself. It turns out I was wrong - the host does indeed power the implant.
English
I needed to implant it into myself. Turns out the host does indeed power the implant.

::He then turns to you.::

Hey, $(context.player.Name).
If you need something, now's your last chance.

I gotta pack this stuff up and, of course, I gotta do it all by myself.

And I'm not keen on being left behind. Xile.
Funny, huh? ::He makes a grimace.:: I almost burned my... bits.
Yes, yes.
Uh... ::He awkwardly conceals his underpants.:: 'Kay.
::He pulls up his trainers.:: What is it, $(#man/sis)?
I can extract data from these neat little devices, so if you come across more of them
, bring them to me.
Well, 'kay. We've been through a lot of crap together. No
Better. Kay', no
::He takes a sip of coffee.:: Not bying it.
Fine by me, $(#man/sis). Fine by me. ::He turns away from you.::
Thankfully, all of that is about to come to an end. Xile.
So if your mobile is acting funky - please leave me out of it. Xile.
'Kay, 'kay. The coffeemaker's in my tent. I'm kind of busy with stuff here, so feel free to go there and grab yourself a flask or two.

'Kay. ::He goes to his coffeemaker and presses a button: As the coffee is poured into the t-flask, the air slowly becomes wonderfully saturated with its smell; after a few moments you have in your hands a t-flask full of smoking hot coffee.::
I won't. Don't worry.
xpbl_e6
Huh? Oh! Ha-ha, yeah. ::He scratches the back of his head.::
Yeah, that you certainly did. Xcell.

A friend of mine took me there. We needed some network equipment, and one of his acquaintances there had the best stuff. 

Hexagon's a pretty confusing place. It's like this tall tower with many floors, each one packed with narrow, maze-like passages leading to all sorts of these... xtra places.
::He confirms his understanding with a few quick nods.::
::[Intelligence]:: You mean, something between virtual and actual reality?
::[Hacking]:: Is it something like augmented reality? Real environments with a computer-generated overlays?

The log mentions just that. It seems that the NFT didn't really have much need for authorization checks, 'kay, but they implemented this system to make it more difficult for Biocorp to enter their facilities. Considering they never made it into the Keep, it worked.
I hear you. It's... xtreme. Damn. Xit.

Huh? Hold on, but how did you manage to open the Keep and all of those other facilities with a microchip implanted into a severed arm? I don't know how it is down here, but in North Underrail severed arms tend to be... lifeless, 'kay.
Can they be repaired?
point in holding grudges. We're a team, right, $(#man/sis)?

Oh, yes, you betcha. You see, ever since we got here we've been trying to find a way to enter that building just across from my tent - the Keep. The panel by the gate is totally unresponsive, and the walls are xtremely thick and sturdy - hey, the building did survive the Biocorp assault on the island after all; and, you know, we don't just want to blow things up here unless we really, really - really gotta.

::He pauses, watching you while a pillar of smoke from the hot coffee pirouettes between you and him. With commiseration in his eyes, he softly proceeds.::

You... don't have any coffee beans here?
You overreacted, that's how. You were an *xer*. Simple.
And leave something for me.
English
'Kay, 'kay. I'm kind of busy with stuff here, so feel free to go to my tent and grab yourself a flask or two from the coffeemaker.
'Kay then, $(#man/sis), 'kay. Grab yourself a flask or two from the coffeemaker. And leave something for me.
I am not stressed at all. ::He takes a sip from his t-flask and shakes his head sideways, vacantly staring forward.:: Not at all.
Oh, come on. Are you serious?
'Kay, 'kay!

Naturally the place is home to all kinds of tech gangs and various factions; the Protectorate got no presence there, nope. You gotta be careful where you tread and who you're dealing with, 'cause if you're not, you might find yourself face to face with... I don't know, a cyborg mugger - or a tech harvester. ::He makes a grimace.::

Usually I'd stay out of that place, but that friend... he knows his way around. I just kept my head down and followed.
context.npc_xpbl_as_todd_finalDestination
expedition
::He nods.:: Something like that, yeah. But this is different.
You're thinking in the right direction, but this is something different.
You know what virtual reality is, don't you?
Anyway, I'll, you know, take one of the microchips from a body in the Keep and figure out how the thing is working, 'kay. Once I've got time. I'll let you know what I've discovered.

Hardly. These things are *old*. But their data storage drives - now *those* things are high quality. While a lot of data does end up being unrecoverable in the end, I've had great success so far. You just bring me MPCs and I'll put everything I manage to recover
Want some coffee now?

Now, the building's still got power, 'kay, as we're easily picking that up on our instruments, but so far we haven't found a way to interface with that panel. Until I recovered this data. According to it, the panel is actually a scanner which authenticates a person based on a small active radio-frequency identification, or A-RFID, microchip that is most often implanted in the right hand. So, if we find one of these microchips or learn to-- 

Wait an xin' second... Why am I telling you all this?
xpbl_e6
::He observes you with satisfying interest.:: Well...
No problem.
Huh... ::He nods a few times.:: A long time.
But then, after I was introduced to XR, I bought this living cube in-- ::And then he shuts up.::
This is *xcell*!
You put on a headset, maybe connect the electrodes, enter a gyrosphere if you got it, and then you're in this totally computer-generated world.

::And so, each sentence that comes out of your mouth further bleaches Seeger's face until unhealthy shades of green begin to appear.::

Xit...

::...is the only word he uses for the duration of your talk.::
on that PC over there. ::He points to the computer next to his own.:: That one.
on my PC in the tent.
I sure would.

Wow. I'm sorry. I knew things were bad here, but this bad? Xit. *X*. *it*. But you have, like, hydroponics, right? You are capable of growing certain plants here? Then why no real coffee? I don't get it.
Enjoy your coffee, $(#man/sis). Xcell.
Xit! I actually believed you for a moment. ::He takes a sip.:: You aren't so bad after all.
'Kay. My girlfriend does that often. Stares. Angrily. Hey, it's what they do.
Go on.
XR?
Is this the virtual reality Professor Oldfield mentioned?
You know how regular virtual reality works already:

But miXed Reality is different: Some of it is real, some of it is virtual. ::He glances around once again before proceeding.:: 'Kay, now, there's this thing called a *miXR* you gotta step into. It's like a gyrosphere, but there are no headsets, electrodes or anything you have to put on. 

You step into it, the entrance closes - and the session starts.

::After you're done with the story, he takes a moment to wipe his forehead before saying something other than "xit".::

'Kay...
Feel free to browse the files once I'm done.

Well... 'kay. 

We find a working chip and we're in. All other NFT facilities should work the same way, so we'll be able to gain access to those as well... if we can get through the natives.
Look, I'm sorry for offending you. It wasn't my intention. My tongue sometimes gets a head start on my brain. That's all I can say. Sorry, $(#man/sis).
It costs a lot of credits, but it's worth it, $(#man/sis). Hexagonians are going crazy over it.
So... the sterilization chemical killed it? ::He twiches his hand as a reference to your story.:: Like it were some kind of a virus?
In fact, you know, there is one already there. It's from one of NFT soldier's MPCs. Check it out.
Anyway, it seems every NFT citizen had an implant. These implants also contained some other, personal data, but that is of secondary importance right now.

::He shakes his head in.:: $(#No man/No one) should live without good xin' coffee. 

You know, I got some more here. ::He glances at the coffeemaker on the other table.::
consumables\food\xpbl\coffee
Down here we'd say "going derailed."
'Kay now... let's see what we got.
::He nods with a smile.:: Xcell.
So that's how we're gonna play.
Sure. Xrailed, hah.

Yeah, so, when you're in virtual reality, everything's digital; the computer reacts to what you do - you affect the virtual. But in mixed reality - the real things can... get affected by virtual things.

Xit.

::He takes a sip of coffee, appearing as though he is sipping some color back into his face.::

You know what? Let's not talk about this ever again.

Now *that's* the-- ::An ascending two-note sound interrupts your conversation, and something flashes on the bottom of his right screen.::

Xcuse me for a moment. It's the professor.
Go for it.
And I even made coffee for you.
Xer.
Xile...

::He puts his coffee aside and his headset on, adjusts the microphone and clicks the icon flashing on his screen. A window pops up, its top right corner bearing what appears to be the University of Dis logo - an outline of a frontal view of a grandiose building placed in a circle, under which "University of Dis" is written in a serif font. Then the face of Professor Oldfield appears, speaking words only Seeger can hear.::

Yes, sir?

You did?

I don't know. No one knows - that's why it's so xcell! Everything around you changes, and you can't even tell you're inside the miXR anymore. You can feel the air currents, smell things, touch, taste, feel. 

The sessions themselves range from just visiting places, meeting people, flying, doing... all kinds of things.

::He turns to you, still talking to the Professor.::

Huh? Yes, $(#he/she)'s here...

I'll tell $(#him/her).

::He is still facing you, but his gleaming eyes are looking through you.::

Oh, thank you, sir.

::He smiles.:: I know.

I am well aware of that, sir. Xcell.

I... dropped the comm once the attack started and broke it.

Yes, yes, I understand.
Nah... *Flying*.
You can get abilities you never knew were possible! You can see things beyond real, virtual - you can't even tell.
Listen:

::Just as you open your mouth, his face disappears behind a broad smile.::

Really?

Yes, sir. Thank you again, sir. Xtra! Yes, yes, I'll tell $(#him/her) what you said. Goodbye.

::His voice drops almost to a whisper.:: There are... also some dark things going on in XR. People... some people get killed in the miXRs. Things that are brought in end up somewhere else. Some people disappear. 

I stay away from those kind of sessions. I don't have the courage for that. Where I go to, I do some Dreadnought piloting... and some other things.
That you should see him now.
That? No, no, no, no, no! Some do, but I... haven't found a good-- Not that I was looking for it. I'd try it, but-- I haven't.

::He shrugs.:: No one's got a clue. It just suddenly appeared, and now it's here and everyone who knows about it is spending all their credits on it. 

I'm new to all of this, $(#man/sis), so I know little, but I think one of the factions there is pushing this. Just a rumor, 'kay.
Anyway, this whole mystery, the possibilites, everything I told you about miXed Reality is why it's so thrilling. That's why the Hexagonians are going
Actually, the professor will fill you in on the rest.
Yes, but not to you.
'Kay. See ya.
derailed over it.
crazy over it.
I... haven't thought about it. Everything's so real, but... Hmmm...
So there. Now you know. And remember, keep this to yourself, 'kay?
Part of it is real, part of it isn't.

::He pauses, sipping his coffee.:: Xit.

No, no, no, it can't be. I know what I experienced. But then again... But it can't... ::He sips some more coffee.::
Y-- You better go see the professor.
